title: If you are smurfing...
body:
1) I don't want to hear that you are smurfing
2) You must still respect Pick Order
3) I want to improve, not have easy, free, undeserved wins.
4) You had better be smurfing to learn something, like an off-role or a new champion.
5) Don't even think about trash-talking; you willingly played with people of lower skill.
6) Don't you dare say you are "carrying" us for whatever reason. You're having fun yourself by abusing lower skilled players.

Edit: #6 thanks to alcatrazEscapee

I think you misunderstood his comment.  unless im mistaken, he isn't referring to flat out trash talk, but teasing and messing around.  personally, I have matches all the time where it's a completely 1 way game, even ones where I had **3** people dc, but when you stop taking the game super seriously and just have fun, you end up enjoying the game quite a bit.  all it takes is the right attitude.  now granted, some comments shouldn't be made joking or not (half because there is sadly no such thing as a sarcasm font), but there's no harm in just joking around with the enemy team, ESPECIALLY if some of those jokes are at your own expense.

I think he's referring to what's know as "friendly banter." 

Trash talk is rubbing your victory in your opponent's face. It's saying "GG, ez" at the end of a match and does not belong in any kind of competitive event. 

Friendly banter is making jokes with your opponent, making light of what, at the end of the day, really is just a video game. It's making fun of your own mistakes just as much as your opponents, and can turn a really shitty experience into a fun time for everyone. Because that's what this is all about, isn't it? Just relaxing and having fun with people in a game we all love.

I have a smurf so I want to address some of these points.

1) If I try to give someone advice on stuff like last hitting and build and they get bitchy because "I don't need advice from a level 5" I will link my plat account. Otherwise... yeah... no one gives a shit if you are smurfing or not.

2) Try to communicate with your team so that everyone gets something they are comfortable with > blindly following pick order. I have given up my best role so that someone else could have their's even though I was higher pick. I can play any role decently but I prefer jungle. If Jungle and mid is left and I pick first and the other player says they can't play mid well I should take it. Teamwork > Pick Order.

3) You can always learn from playing against or with a smurf. If you aren't improving that is your fault. Not the smurf's.

4) I smurf because there is no meta at low levels and I want to play what is fun instead of what is strong. You have no right to tell someone how to play their game.

5) Why is this exclusive for smurfs? How about don't talk shit in general?

If someone claims to be smurfing, I almost never listen to them. About 80% of the time, it turns out to be a 2 year old kid that just rages all game and goes 2/10.

1) I don't care whether someone is smurfing or not. Nothing is different for me, and I will pick/ban and play no different than I would otherwise.
2) I will pick/ban the same champs I would normally, and I don't give a fk if you think Nid is op. Nobody plays her in S4.
3) I couldn't agree more with this. I hate games where 1 person dominates or loses the game singlehandedly.
4) If they're smurfing to smash low elo players, I'll just split push usually to avoid being part of the arrogance and insecurity.
5) If anyone ever says anything that makes me so much as think negative thoughts, I mute them immediately. I hate this community. lol

The whole idea of smurfing seems very unethical. People are making accounts just so they can have an easy time farming off new players? Doesn't seem like the  best reason to make a smurf. I understand making new accounts if you're moving to a new region or something but there's hardly any legitimate reason to make a smurf without making you sound like an ass. If you want to learn a new champ then try bot games or suck it up because don't expect to automatically win with champs that you have not completely mastered. Losing is just apart of competition.

I don't expect people to be very ethical on the internet, though.
